max_duration.description: Maximum time in seconds to wait for an answer. Cannot be less than `7` seconds. Defaults to 14400 seconds.

codecs.description:
Comma-seperated string of codecs to offer.
 Valid codecs are: [`PCMU,PCMA,G722,G729,AMR-WB,OPUS,VP8,H264`]

global_data.description:
A powerful and flexible environmental variable which can accept arbitrary data that is set initially in the SWML script
or from the SWML `set_global_data` action. This data can be referenced `globally`.
All contained information can be accessed and expanded within the prompt - for example, by using a template string.

hints.description: An array of hints (as strings) to provide context to the dialogue.

languages.description: An array of JSON objects defining supported languages in the conversation.

params.description: A JSON object containing parameters as key-value pairs.

post_prompt.description: The final set of instructions and configuration settings to send to the agent.

post_prompt_url.description: The URL to which to send status callbacks and reports. Authentication can also be set in the url in the format of `username:password@url`.

pronounce.description: An array of JSON objects to clarify the AI's pronunciation of words or expressions.

prompt.description: Establishes the initial set of instructions and settings to configure the agent.

SWAIG.description: An array of JSON objects to create user-defined functions/endpoints that can be executed during the dialogue.

cond.description: Execute a sequence of instructions depending on the value of a JavaScript condition.
cond.title: cond

connect.description: Dial a SIP URI or phone number.

denoise.description: Start noise reduction. You can stop it at any time using `stop_denoise`.

dest.description:
Specifies what to execute. The value can be one of: 
<section_name> - section in the current document to execute.
https://<URL>" - URL pointing to the document to execute. Sends HTTP POST.

params.description: Named parameters to send to section or URL

on_return.description: The list of SWML instructions to be executed when the executed section or URL returns

anyOf.description: Execute a sequence of instructions depending on the value of a JavaScript condition.
anyOf.title: cond

result.description: `switch` on `return_value` if result is an object (`{}`), or use as a cond if result is an array (`[]`)

execute.description: Execute a section or URL as a subroutine and return back to current document.

label.description: The name of the label in the current section to jump to.

when.description: The condition that triggers the `goto` jump.

max.description: The maximum number of times to perform the jump. Must be a number between 1 and 100.

meta.description:
User-defined metadata to be stored with the jump. This metadata is ignored by SignalWire and the
default is not set.

goto.description: Jump to a specified label in the current SWML document.

label.description: The name of the label in the current section to jump to.

action.description: The action to perform during live transcription.

live_transcribe.description: Starts live transcription of the call. The transcription will be sent to the specified URL.
live_transcribe.title: live_transcribe

action.description: The action to perform during live translation.

live_translate.description: Starts a live translation session of the call. The translation will be sent to the specified URL.
live_translate.title: live_translate

reason.description: The reason for hanging up the call.

name.description: The name of the room to join.

play.description: Play file(s), ringtones, speech or silence.
play.title: play

play.description:
URL or array of URLs to play.
Allowed URLs are:
    http:// or https:// - audio file to GET
    ring:[duration:]<country code> - ring tone to play. For example: ring:us to play single ring or ring:20.0:us to play ring for 20 seconds.
    say:<text to speak> - Sentence to say
    silence: <duration> - seconds of silence to play

volume.description:
Volume level for the audio file.
Default is 0.
Valid range is -40 to 40.

say_voice.description:
The voice to use for the text to speech.
Default is `Polly.Salli`.

say_language.description:
The language to use for the text to speech.
Default is `en-US`.

say_gender.description:
The gender to use for the text to speech.
Default is `female`.

max_digits.description:
Number of digits to collect.
Default is `1`.

terminators.description:
Digits that terminate digit collection.
Default is not set.

digit_timeout.description:
Time in seconds to wait for next digit.
Default is `5.0` seconds.

initial_timeout.description:
Time in seconds to wait for start of input.
Default is `5.0` seconds.

speech_timeout.description: Max time in seconds to wait for speech result.

speech_end_timeout.description: Time in seconds to wait for end of speech utterance.

speech_hints.description: Words or phrases to help the speech recognition.

speech_engine.description:
The engine that is selected for speech recognition. The engine must support the specified language.
[Deepgram|Google| etc...] Default is not set (SignalWire picks the engine).

status_url.description: http or https URL to deliver prompt status events

prompt.description:
Play a prompt and wait for digit or speech input.
Speech detection is not enabled unless at least one speech parameter is set.
If only speech parameters are set (and no digit parameters), digit detection is not enabled.
To enable both digit and speech detection, set at least one parameter for each.
prompt.title: prompt

status_url.description: http or https URL to deliver receive_fax status events

receive_fax.description: Receive a fax being delivered to this call.
receive_fax.title: receive_fax

stereo.description:
If true, record in stereo.
Default is false.

format.description:
The format to record in. Can be `wav` or `mp3`.
Default is "wav".

direction.description:
Direction of the audio to record: "speak" for what party says, "listen" for what party hears.
Default is `speak`.

terminators.description: String of digits that will stop the recording when pressed.

beep.description:
Play a beep before recording.
Default is `false`.

input_sensitivity.description:
Input sensitivity for the recording.
Default is `44.0`.

initial_timeout.description:
Time in seconds to wait for the start of speech.
Default is `4.0` seconds.

end_silence_timeout.description:
Time in seconds to wait in silence before ending the recording.
Default is `5.0` seconds.

max_length.description: Maximum length of the recording in seconds.

status_url.description: URL to send recording status events to.

record.description: Record the call audio in the foreground. Use this, for example, to record voicemails.
record.title: record

control_id.description: Identifier for this recording, to use with `stop_call_record`.

stereo.description:
If `true`, record in stereo.
Default is `false`.

format.description:
The format to record in. It can be `wav` or `mp3`.
Default is `wav`.

direction.description:
Direction of the audio to record: "speak" for what party says, "listen" for what party hears, "both" for what the party hears and says.
Default is `both`.

terminators.description: String of digits that will stop the recording when pressed.

beep.description:
Play a beep before recording.
Default is `false`.

input_sensitivity.description:
Input sensitivity for the recording.
Default is `44.0`.

initial_timeout.description:
Time in seconds to wait for the start of speech.
Default is `0.0` seconds.

end_silence_timeout.description:
Time in seconds to wait in silence before ending the recording.
Default is `0.0` seconds.

max_length.description: Maximum length of the recording in seconds.

status_url.description: http or https URL to deliver record_call status events

record_call.description:
Record call in the background.
Unlike the `record` method, the `record_call` method will start the recording and continue executing the SWML script without allowing the recording to happen in the background.
To stop call recordings started with `record_call`, use the `stop_call_record` method.
record_call.title: record_call

url.description: The URL to which the request is to be sent.

method.description: The HTTP method to be used for the request. Can be `GET`, `POST`, `PUT`, or `DELETE`.

headers.description: An object representing the headers to be included in the request.

body.description: The body of the request. Can be a `string` or an `object`.

timeout.description:
Maximum time in seconds to wait for a response.
Default is `5.0` seconds.

connect_timeout.description:
Maximum time in seconds to wait for a connection.
Default is `5.0` seconds.

result.description: `switch` on `return_value` if result is an object (`{}`), or use as a cond if result is an array (`[]`).

save_variables.description:
Store parsed JSON response as variables.
Default is `false`.

request.description: Send a GET, POST, PUT, or DELETE request to a remote URL.
request.title: request

return.description: Return from `execute` or exit script. Takes user-defined key to be used to store the value.
return.title: return

document.description: URL to the PDF document to fax.

header_info.description: Header text to include on the fax.

identity.description:
Station identity to report.
Default is the calling party's caller ID number.

status_url.description: http or https URL to deliver send_fax status events

send_sms.description: Send a text message to a PSTN phone number.
send_sms.title: send_sms

set.description:
Set script variables to the specified values.
No specific parameters.
Accepts an object mapping variable names to values.
set.title: set

sleep.description: The amount of time to sleep in milliseconds. Must be a `positive integer`. Can also be set to a `-1` integer for the sleep to never end.
sleep.title: sleep

to_uri.description: The SIP URI to send the REFER to.

sip_refer.description: Send SIP REFER to a SIP call.
sip_refer.title: sip_refer

control_id.description:
Identifier for the recording to stop.
If not set, the last recording started will be stopped.

ID of the tap to stop.
If not set, it will shut off the most recent tap session.

variable.description: Name of the variable whose value needs to be compared

case.description: Object of values mapped to array of instructions to execute

default.description: Array of instructions to execute if no cases match

switch.description: Execute a sequence of instructions depending on which value matches a variable.
switch.title: switch

uri.description: Destination of the tap media stream.

control_id.description: Identifier for this tap to use with `stop_tap`.

direction.description:
Direction of the audio to tap:
    `speak` for what party says,
    `listen` for what party hears,
    `both` for what party hears and says.
    Default is `speak`

codec.description:
Codec to use for the tap media stream.
Possible Values: [`PCMU`, `PCMA`]
Default is `PCMU`

rtp_ptime.description:
If `uri` is a `rtp://` this will set the packetization time of the media in milliseconds.
Default is `20` miliseconds.

status_url.description: http or https URL to deliver tap status events

tap.description: Start background call tap. Media is streamed over Websocket or RTP to customer controlled URI.
tap.title: tap

dest.description:
Specifies where to transfer the call. The value can be one of:
    - `<section_name>` - section in the SWML document to jump to.
    - `https://<URL>` - URL pointing to the document to transfer to. Sends HTTP POST.

params.description:
Named parameters to send to transfer destination.
Accepts an object mapping variable names to values.
Default is not set.

meta.description:
User data, ignored by SignalWire.
Accepts an object mapping variable names to values.
Default is not set.

transfer.description: Transfer the execution of the script to a new URL or SWML Section.
transfer.title: transfer

vars.description: Names of the variables to unset.

unset.description: Un set a variable that as been `set`.
unset.title: unset

payment_connector_url.description:
The URL to make POST requests with all the gathered payment details.
This URL is used to process the final payment transaction and return the results through the response.

Visit https://developer.signalwire.com//swml/methods/pay/payment_connector_url for more important information.

charge_amount.description: The amount to charge against payment method passed in the request. `Float` value with no currency prefix passed as string.

currency.description: Uses the ISO 4217 currency code of the charge amount. Default is `usd`.

description.description: Custom description of the payment provided in the request.

input.description: The method of how to collect the payment details. Currently only `dtmf` mode is supported.

language.description:
The language of the payment prompt. Default is `en-US`.

Supported languages can be found here: https://developer.signalwire.com/swml/methods/pay/language

max_attempts.description: Number of times the `pay` method will retry to collect payment details. Default is `1`.

min_postal_code_length.description: The minimum length of the postal code the user must enter. Default is `0`.

parameters.description: Array of parameter objects to pass to your payment processor. The parameters are user-defined key-value pairs.

payment_method.description: Indicates the payment method which is going to be used in this payment request. Currently only `credit-card` is supported.

postal_code.description: Takes `true`, `false` or real postalcode (if it's known beforehand) to let pay method know whether to prompt for postal code.

prompts.description: Array of prompt objects for customizing the audio prompts during different stages of the payment process.

security_code.description: Takes true or false to let pay method know whether to prompt for security code. Default is `true`.

status_url.description:
The URL to send requests for each status change during the payment process.

See http://localhost:3000/swml/methods/pay#status_url_request_body for more important information.

timeout.description: Limit in seconds that pay method waits for the caller to press another digit before moving on to validate the digits captured.

token_type.description:
Whether the payment is a one off payment or re-occurring. Default is `reusable`.

Allowed values: 
- `one-time`
- `reusable`

valid_card_types.description:
List of payment cards allowed to use in the requested payment process separated by space.

Allowed values: 
- `visa`
- `mastercard`
- `amex`
- `maestro`
- `discover`
- `jcb`
- `diners-club`

error_type.description:
Space-separated list of error types this prompt applies to.

Allowed Error Types: 
- `payment-card-number` - Collect the payment card number.
- `expiration-date` - Collect the payment card expiration date.
- `security-code` - Collect the payment card security code.
- `postal-code` - Collect the payment card postal code.
- `payment-processing` - The step used during the payment processing.
- `payment-completed` - The step used when the payment is completed.
- `payment-failed` - The step used when the payment fails.
- `payment-canceled` - The step used when the payment is cancelled.

voice.description: Text-to-speech voice to use. Defaults is 'woman'. Please refer to https://developer.signalwire.com//voice/getting-started/voice-and-languages for more information.

pay.description:
The `pay` object. Enables secure payment processing during a call.
 When implemented, it handles the complete payment flow including data collection, validation, and processing through your configured
 payment gateway.

acknowledge_interruptions.description: Instructs the agent to acknowledge crosstalk and confirm user input when the user speaks over the agent.

ai_volume.description: Adjust the volume of the AI. Allowed values from `-50` - `50`.

attention_timeout.description: Amount of time, in ms, to wait before prompting the user to respond. Allowed values from `10,000` - `600,000`. Set to `0` to disable.

attention_timeout_prompt.description: A custom prompt that is fed into the AI when the attention_timeout is reached.

background_file.description: URL of audio file to play in the background while AI plays in foreground.

background_file_loops.description: Maximum number of times to loop playing the background file. `undefined` means loop indefinitely.

background_file_volume.description: Defines background_file volume within a range of `-50` to `50`.

barge_match_string.description:
Takes a string, including a regular expression, defining barge behavior.
 For example, this param can direct the AI to stop when the word 'hippopotomus' is input.

barge_min_words.description: Defines the number of words that must be input before triggering barge behavior, in a range of `1-99`.

conscience.description: Sets the prompt which binds the agent to its purpose.

conversation_id.description: Used by `check_for_input` and `save_conversation` to identify an individual conversation.

debug_webhook_level.description: Enables debugging to the set URL. Allowed values from `0` - `2`. Default is `1` if url is set.

debug_webhook_url.description: Each interaction between the AI and end user is posted in real time to the established URL.

direction.description: Forces the direction of the call to the assistant. Valid values are `inbound` and `outbound`.

digit_termiantors.description: DTMF digit, as a string, to signal the end of input (ex: '#')

digit_timeout.description: Time, in ms, at the end of digit input to detect end of input. Allowed values from `250` - `10,000`.

end_of_speech_timeout.description: Amount of silence, in ms, at the end of an utterance to detect end of speech. Allowed values from `250` - `10,000`.

eleven_labs_stability.description: The stability slider determines how stable the voice is and the randomness between each generation. Lowering this slider introduces a broader emotional range for the voice.

eleven_labs_similarity.description: The similarity slider dictates how closely the AI should adhere to the original voice when attempting to replicate it. The higher the similarity, the closer the AI will sound to the original voice.

enable_vision.description:
Enables visual input processing for the AI Agent. 
When set to `true`, the AI Agent will be able to utilize visual processing capabilities, while leveraging the `get_visual_input` function.

energy_level.description: Amount of energy necessary for bot to hear you (in dB). Allowed values from `0.0` - `100.0`.

function_wait_for_talking.description:
If `true`, the AI will wait for any `filler` to finish playing before executing a function. 
If `false`, the AI will execute a function asynchronously as the `filler` plays. 
Default is `false`.

hard_stop_prompt.description: A final prompt that is fed into the AI when the `hard_stop_time` is reached.

hard_stop_time.description:
Specifies the maximum duration fopr the AI Agent to remain active before it exists the session. 
After the timeout, the AI will stop responding, and will proceed with the next SWML instruction.

**Time Format:**
  - Seconds Format: `30s`
  - Minutes Format: `2m`
  - Hours Format: `1h`
  - Combined Format: `1h45m30s`

hold_music.description: A URL for the hold music to play, accepting WAV, mp3, and FreeSWITCH tone_stream.

hold_on_process.description: Enables hold music during SWAIG processing.

inactivity_timeout.description: Amount of time, in ms, to wait before exiting the app due to inactivity. Allowed values from `10,000` - `3,600,000`.

initial_sleep_ms.description: Amount of time, in ms, to wait before starting the conversation. Allowed values from `0` - `300,000`.

input_poll_freq.description:
Check for input function with check_for_input. 
Example use case: Feeding an inbound SMS to AI on a voice call, eg., for collecting an email address or other complex information.

interrupt_on_noise.description: When enabled, barges agent upon any sound interruption longer than 1 second.

interrupt_prompt.description: Provide a prompt for the agent to handle crosstalk.

local_tz.description: The local timezone setting for the AI. Value should use `IANA TZ ID`

outbound_attention_timeout.description: Sets a time duration for the outbound call recipient to respond to the AI agent before timeout, in a range from `10000` to `600000`.

save_conversation.description:
Send a summary of the conversation after the call ends.
This requires a `post_url` to be set in the ai parameters and the `conversation_id` defined below.
This eliminates the need for a `post_prompt` in the ai parameters.

swaig_allow_settings.description: Allows tweaking any of the indicated settings, such as `barge_match_string`, using the returned SWML from the SWAIG function.

swaig_allow_swml.description: Allows your SWAIG to return SWML to be executed.

swaig_post_conversation.description: Post entire conversation to any SWAIG call.

transfer_summary.description: Pass a summary of a conversation from one AI agent to another. For example, transfer a call summary between support agents in two departments.

video_listening_file.description: URL of a video file to play when AI is listening to the user speak. Only works for calls that support video.

video_idle_file.description: URL of a video file to play when AI is idle. Only works for calls that support video.

video_talking_file.description: URL of a video file to play when AI is talking. Only works for calls that support video.

wait_for_user.description: When false, AI agent will initialize dialogue after call is setup. When true, agent will wait for the user to speak first.

pom.description:
Prompt Object Model (POM) is a structured data format for composing, organizing, and rendering prompt instructions for AI agents.
POM ensures that the prompt is structured in a way that is best for the AI agent to understand and execute.
The first item in the array MUST be FirstPOMSection (with optional title).
All subsequent items MUST be PomSection (with required title and body).

text.description: The instructions to send to the agent.

temperature.description: Randomness setting. Float value between 0.0 and 1.5. Closer to 0 will make the output less random.

top_p.description: Randomness setting. Alternative to `temperature`. Float value between 0.0 and 1.0. Closer to 0 will make the output less random.

confidence.description:
Threshold to fire a speech-detect event at the end of the utterance. Float value between 0.0 and 1.0. 
Decreasing this value will reduce the pause after the user speaks, but may introduce false positives.

presence_penalty.description: Aversion to staying on topic. Float value between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values increase the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

frequency_penalty.description: Aversion to repeating lines. Float value between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values decrease the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

with.description: The phonetic spelling of the expression.

ignore_case.description: Whether the pronunciation replacement should ignore case.

pom.description:
Prompt Object Model (POM) is a structured data format for composing, organizing, and rendering prompt instructions for AI agents.
POM ensures that the prompt is structured in a way that is best for the AI agent to understand and execute.
The first item in the array MUST be FirstPOMSection (with optional title).
All subsequent items MUST be PomSection (with required title and body).

text.description: The instructions to send to the agent.

temperature.description: Randomness setting. Float value between 0.0 and 1.5. Closer to 0 will make the output less random.

top_p.description: Randomness setting. Alternative to `temperature`. Float value between 0.0 and 1.0. Closer to 0 will make the output less random.

confidence.description:
Threshold to fire a speech-detect event at the end of the utterance. Float value between 0.0 and 1.0. 
Decreasing this value will reduce the pause after the user speaks, but may introduce false positives.

presence_penalty.description: Aversion to staying on topic. Float value between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values increase the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

frequency_penalty.description: Aversion to repeating lines. Float value between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values decrease the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

contexts.description:
An object that defines the context steps for the AI. The context steps are used to define the flow of the conversation.
Every context object requires a `default` key, which is the default context to use at the beginning of the conversation.
Additionally, more context steps can be defined as any other key in the object.

defaults.description: Default settings for all SWAIG functions. If `defaults` is not set, settings may be set in each function object. Default is not set.

native_functions.description: Prebuilt functions the AI agent is able to call from this list of available native functions

includes.description:
An array of objects to include remote function signatures.
The object fields are url to specify where the remote functions are defined and functions which is an array of the function names as strings.

functions.description:
An array of JSON objects to define functions that can be executed during the interaction with the AI. Default is not set.
The fields of this object are the six following.

internal_fillers.description: These are the internal fillers that can be executed during the interaction with the AI while utilizing internal functions.

from.description: The caller ID to use when dialing the number.

headers.description: Custom SIP headers to add to INVITE. It Has no effect on calls to phone numbers.

codecs.description:
Comma-separated string of codecs to offer.
It has no effect on calls to phone numbers.
Based on SignalWire settings.

webrtc_media.description:
If true, WebRTC media is offered to the SIP endpoint.
It has no effect on calls to phone numbers.
Default is `false`.

session_timeout.description:
Time, in seconds, to set the SIP `Session-Expires` header in INVITE.
Must be a positive, non-zero number.
It has no effect on calls to phone numbers.
Based on SignalWire settings.

ringback.description: Array of URIs to play as ringback tone.

anyOf.description: Execute a sequence of instructions depending on the value of a JavaScript condition.
anyOf.title: cond

result.description: `switch` on `return_value` when object `{}` or `cond` when array `[]`

timeout.description:
Time, in seconds, to wait for the call to be answered.
Default is 60 seconds.

max_duration.description:
Maximum duration, in seconds, allowed for the call.
Default is `14400` seconds.

answer_on_bridge.description:
Delay answer until the B-leg answers.
Default is `false`.

call_state_url.description: Webhook URL to send call state change notifications to for all legs. It can be overwritten on each destination.

call_state_events.description:
An array of call state event names to be notified about.
Allowed event names are:
    - `created`
    - `ringing`
    - `answered`
    - `ended`

confirm_timeout.description: The amount of time, in seconds, to wait for the `confirm` URL to return a response

status_url.description: http or https URL to deliver connect status events

to.description: The SIP URI or phone number to dial.

from.description: The caller ID to use when dialing the number.

headers.description: Custom SIP headers to add to INVITE. It Has no effect on calls to phone numbers.

codecs.description:
Comma-separated string of codecs to offer.
It has no effect on calls to phone numbers.
Based on SignalWire settings.

webrtc_media.description:
If true, WebRTC media is offered to the SIP endpoint.
It has no effect on calls to phone numbers.
Default is `false`.

session_timeout.description:
Time, in seconds, to set the SIP `Session-Expires` header in INVITE.
Must be a positive, non-zero number.
It has no effect on calls to phone numbers.
Based on SignalWire settings.

ringback.description: Array of URIs to play as ringback tone.

anyOf.description: Execute a sequence of instructions depending on the value of a JavaScript condition.
anyOf.title: cond

result.description: `switch` on `return_value` when object `{}` or `cond` when array `[]`

timeout.description:
Time, in seconds, to wait for the call to be answered.
Default is 60 seconds.

max_duration.description:
Maximum duration, in seconds, allowed for the call.
Default is `14400` seconds.

answer_on_bridge.description:
Delay answer until the B-leg answers.
Default is `false`.

call_state_url.description: Webhook URL to send call state change notifications to for all legs. It can be overwritten on each destination.

call_state_events.description:
An array of call state event names to be notified about.
Allowed event names are:
    - `created`
    - `ringing`
    - `answered`
    - `ended`

confirm_timeout.description: The amount of time, in seconds, to wait for the `confirm` URL to return a response

status_url.description: http or https URL to deliver connect status events

from.description: The caller ID to use when dialing the number.

headers.description: Custom SIP headers to add to INVITE. It Has no effect on calls to phone numbers.

codecs.description:
Comma-separated string of codecs to offer.
It has no effect on calls to phone numbers.
Based on SignalWire settings.

webrtc_media.description:
If true, WebRTC media is offered to the SIP endpoint.
It has no effect on calls to phone numbers.
Default is `false`.

session_timeout.description:
Time, in seconds, to set the SIP `Session-Expires` header in INVITE.
Must be a positive, non-zero number.
It has no effect on calls to phone numbers.
Based on SignalWire settings.

ringback.description: Array of URIs to play as ringback tone.

anyOf.description: Execute a sequence of instructions depending on the value of a JavaScript condition.
anyOf.title: cond

result.description: `switch` on `return_value` when object `{}` or `cond` when array `[]`

timeout.description:
Time, in seconds, to wait for the call to be answered.
Default is 60 seconds.

max_duration.description:
Maximum duration, in seconds, allowed for the call.
Default is `14400` seconds.

answer_on_bridge.description:
Delay answer until the B-leg answers.
Default is `false`.

call_state_url.description: Webhook URL to send call state change notifications to for all legs. It can be overwritten on each destination.

call_state_events.description:
An array of call state event names to be notified about.
Allowed event names are:
    - `created`
    - `ringing`
    - `answered`
    - `ended`

confirm_timeout.description: The amount of time, in seconds, to wait for the `confirm` URL to return a response

status_url.description: http or https URL to deliver connect status events

parallel.description: Array of destinations to dial simultaneously.

from.description: The caller ID to use when dialing the number.

headers.description: Custom SIP headers to add to INVITE. It Has no effect on calls to phone numbers.

codecs.description:
Comma-separated string of codecs to offer.
It has no effect on calls to phone numbers.
Based on SignalWire settings.

webrtc_media.description:
If true, WebRTC media is offered to the SIP endpoint.
It has no effect on calls to phone numbers.
Default is `false`.

session_timeout.description:
Time, in seconds, to set the SIP `Session-Expires` header in INVITE.
Must be a positive, non-zero number.
It has no effect on calls to phone numbers.
Based on SignalWire settings.

ringback.description: Array of URIs to play as ringback tone.

anyOf.description: Execute a sequence of instructions depending on the value of a JavaScript condition.
anyOf.title: cond

result.description: `switch` on `return_value` when object `{}` or `cond` when array `[]`

timeout.description:
Time, in seconds, to wait for the call to be answered.
Default is 60 seconds.

max_duration.description:
Maximum duration, in seconds, allowed for the call.
Default is `14400` seconds.

answer_on_bridge.description:
Delay answer until the B-leg answers.
Default is `false`.

call_state_url.description: Webhook URL to send call state change notifications to for all legs. It can be overwritten on each destination.

call_state_events.description:
An array of call state event names to be notified about.
Allowed event names are:
    - `created`
    - `ringing`
    - `answered`
    - `ended`

confirm_timeout.description: The amount of time, in seconds, to wait for the `confirm` URL to return a response

status_url.description: http or https URL to deliver connect status events

serial_parallel.description:
Array of arrays.
Inner arrays contain destinations to dial simultaneously.
Outer array attempts each parallel group in order.

variable.description:
Name of the variable whose value needs to be compared. If not provided, it will check the `return_value` variable.
Can be one of the listed set of variables, or a string to represent a custom variable.

case.description: Object of values mapped to array of instructions to execute

default.description: Array of instructions to execute if no cases match

oneOf.description: Stops live transcription of the call.
Stops live translation of the call.

auto_answer.description: If `true`, the call will automatically answer as the sound is playing. If `false`, you will start playing the audio during early media

volume.description:
Volume level for the audio file.
Default is `0`.
Valid range is -40 to 40

say_voice.description:
The voice to use for the text to speech.
Default is `Polly.Salli`

say_language.description:
The language to use for the text to speech.
Default is `en-US`

say_gender.description:
Gender to use for the text to speech.
Default is `female`.

status_url.description: http or https URL to deliver play status events

url.description:
URL to play.
Required if `urls` is not present.
Allowed URLs are:
    - http:// or https:// - audio file to GET
    - ring:[duration:]<country code> - ring tone to play. For example: ring:us to play single ring or ring:20.0:us to play ring for 20 seconds.
    - say:<text to speak> - Sentence to say
    - silence: <duration> - seconds of silence to play

auto_answer.description: If `true`, the call will automatically answer as the sound is playing. If `false`, you will start playing the audio during early media

volume.description:
Volume level for the audio file.
Default is `0`.
Valid range is -40 to 40

say_voice.description:
The voice to use for the text to speech.
Default is `Polly.Salli`

say_language.description:
The language to use for the text to speech.
Default is `en-US`

say_gender.description:
Gender to use for the text to speech.
Default is `female`.

status_url.description: http or https URL to deliver play status events

urls.description:
Array of URLs to play.
Required if `url` is not present.
Allowed URLs are:
    - http:// or https:// - audio file to GET
    - ring:[duration:]<country code> - ring tone to play. For example: ring:us to play single ring or ring:20.0:us to play ring for 20 seconds.
    - say:<text to speak> - Sentence to say
    - silence: <duration> - seconds of silence to play

to_number.description: The phone number to send the SMS to.

from_number.description:
The phone number to send the SMS from.
Default is the calling party's caller ID number.

region.description: The region to use for the SMS.

tags.description: Array of tags to associate with the message to facilitate log searches.

body.description: Required if `media` is not present. The body of the SMS message.

to_number.description: The phone number to send the SMS to.

from_number.description:
The phone number to send the SMS from.
Default is the calling party's caller ID number.

region.description: The region to use for the SMS.

tags.description: Array of tags to associate with the message to facilitate log searches.

media.description: Required if `body` is not present. Array of media URLs to include in the message.

body.description: Optional if `media` is present. The body of the SMS message.

name.description: The identifier for your custom parameter. This will be the key in the parameters object.

value.description: The value associated with the parameter. This will be the value in the parameters object.

actions.description: Array of action objects to execute for this prompt. These actions can either play an audio file or speak a phrase.

for.description:
The payment step this prompt is for. See Payment Steps for a list of available steps.

- `payment-card-number`: Collect the payment card number.
- `expiration-date`: Collect the payment card expiration date.
- `security-code`: Collect the payment card security code.
- `postal-code`: Collect the payment card postal code.
- `payment-processing`: The step used during the payment processing.
- `payment-completed`: The step used when the payment is completed.
- `payment-failed`: The step used when the payment fails.
- `payment-cancelled`: The step used when the payment is cancelled.

attempts.description:
Specifies which payment attempt(s) this prompt applies to. The value increments when a payment fails.
 Use a single number (e.g., "1") or space-separated numbers (e.g., "2 3") to target the specific attempts.

card_type.description:
Space-seperated list of card types that are allowed to be used for this prompt.

Supported card types:
    - `visa`
    - `mastercard`
    - `amex`
    - `maestro`
    - `discover`
    - `optima`
    - `jcb`
    - `diners-club`

error_type.description:
Space-separated list of error types this prompt applies to

Available error types:
    - `timeout` - User input timeout
    - `invalid-card-number` - Failed card validation
    - `invalid-card-type` - Unsupported card type
    - `invalid-date` - Invalid expiration date
    - `invalid-security-code` - Invalid CVV format
    - `invalid-postal-code` - Invalid postal code format
    - `session-in-progress` - Concurrent session attempt
    - `card-declined` - Payment declined

voice.description: Voice to use for the language. For example, 'fr-FR-Neural2-B'.

engine.description: The engine to use for the language. For example, 'elevenlabs'.

fillers.description: An array of strings to be used as fillers in the conversation. This will be used for both speech and function fillers if provided.

voice.description: Voice to use for the language. For example, 'fr-FR-Neural2-B'.

engine.description: The engine to use for the language. For example, 'elevenlabs'.

function_fillers.description: An array of strings to be used as fillers in the conversation when calling a `swaig function`. This helps the AI break silence between responses. The filler is played asynchronously during the function call.

speech_fillers.description: An array of strings to be used as fillers in the conversation. This helps the AI break silence between responses.

PomSection.description: Regular section that requires either body or bullets and has required title

default.description: The default context to use at the beginning of the conversation. Additional context steps can be defined as any other key in the object.

web_hook_url.description: Default URL to send status callbacks and reports to. Authentication can also be set in the url in the format of `username:password@url.`

functions.description: Remote functions to fetch and include in your AI application.

url.description: URL to fetch remote functions and include in your AI application. Authentication can also be set in the url in the format of `username:password@url`.

function.description: A unique name for the function. For example, 'get_weather'.

description.description: A description of the context and purpose of the function, to explain to the agent when to use it.

purpose.description:
The purpose field has been deprecated and is replaced by the `description` field.
A description of the context and purpose of the function, to explain to the agent when to use it.

parameters.description: A JSON object that defines the expected user input parameters and their validation rules for the function.

fillers.description: A JSON object defining the fillers that should be played when calling a `swaig function`. This helps the AI break silence between responses. The filler is played asynchronously during the function call.

argument.description:
The argument field has been deprecated and is replaced by the `parameters` field. 
A JSON object defining the input that should be passed to the function. 
The fields of this object are the following two parameters.

active.description: Whether the function is active. Default is `true`.

meta_data.description:
A powerful and flexible environmental variable which can accept arbitrary data that is set initially in the SWML script or from the SWML set_meta_data action.
This data can be referenced locally to the function.
All contained information can be accessed and expanded within the prompt - for example, by using a template string.
Default is not set.

meta_data_token.description: Scoping token for meta_data. If not supplied, metadata will be scoped to function's `web_hook_url`. Default is set by SignalWire.

data_map.description:
An object that processes function inputs and executes operations through expressions, webhooks, or direct output.
Properties are evaluated in strict priority order:
1. expressions
2. webhooks
3. output

Evaluation stops at the first property that returns a valid output result, similar to a return statement in a function.
Any subsequent properties are ignored when a valid output is returned.
If a valid output is not returned from any of the properties, a generic error message is returned.

web_hook_url.description: Function-specific URL to send status callbacks and reports to. Takes precedence over a default setting. Authentication can also be set in the url in the format of `username:password@url.`

wait_file.description: A file to play while the function is running. `wait_file_loops` can specify the amount of times that files should continously play. Default is not set.

wait_file_loops.description: The number of times to loop playing the file. Default is not set.

wait_for_fillers.description: Wait for fillers to finish before continuing. Default is not set.

get_visual_input.description: This function is used to visually process input that the AI Agent has captured.

when.description: The condition to be evaluated and act on.

then.description: The list of SWML instructions to be executed if the condition is `true`

else.description: The list of SWML instructions to be executed if the condition is `false`.
The list of SWML instructions to be executed if the condition is `false`.

variable.description: Name of the variable whose value needs to be compared. If not provided, it will check the `connect_result` variable.

case.description: Object of values mapped to array of instructions to execute

default.description: Array of instructions to execute if no cases match

webhook.description: The webhook URL the transcription will be sent to.

vad_silence_ms.description: Voice activity detection silence time in milliseconds.

direction.description: The direction of the call that should be transcribed.

speech_engine.description: The speech engine to be used.

start.description: Starts live transcription of the call. The transcription will be sent to the specified URL.

oneOf.description: Summarizes the conversation as a string value.

webhook.description: The webhook URL to be called.

from_voice.description: The TTS voice you want to use for the source language.

to_voice.description: The TTS voice you want to use for the target language.

vad_silence_ms.description: Voice activity detection silence time in milliseconds.

direction.description: The direction of the call that should be translated.

speech_engine.description: The speech engine to be used.

start.description: Starts live translation of the call. The translation will be sent to the specified URL.

oneOf.description: Summarizes the conversation as a string value.

direction.description: The direction of the message that should be injected.

inject.description: Injects a message into the conversation.

PomSectionBodyContent.description: Content model with body text and optional bullets

PomSectionBulletsContent.description: Content model with bullets and optional body

steps.description: An array of objects that define the steps in the context. These steps are used to define the flow of the conversation.
steps.title: steps

type.description: The type of argument the AI is passing to the function. Possible values are 'string' and 'object'.

properties.description:
An object containing the property definitions that are passed to the function.

A property definition is a valid JSON schema type with dynamic property names, where:
- Keys: User-defined strings, that set the property names.
- Values: A valid property type, which can be one of the following: `string`, `integer`, `number`, `boolean`, `array`, `object`, or `null`.

required.description: An array of required property names from the `properties` object.

default.description: Default language set by the user

output.description:
An object that contains a response and a list of actions to be performed upon a SWAIG function call.
This functions like a return statement in a function.

expressions.description: An array of objects that define patterns and corresponding actions.

webhooks.description: An array of objects that define external API calls.

webhook.description: The webhook URL to be called.

summarize.description: Summarizes the conversation as an object, allowing you to specify the webhook url and prompt for the summary.

webhook.description: The webhook URL to be called.

summarize.description: Summarizes the conversation as an object, allowing you to specify the webhook url and prompt for the summary.

type.description: When the action `type` is `Say`, this value is the text to be spoken; when the type is `Play`, it should be a URL to the audio file.
When the action `type` is `Say`, this value is the text to be spoken; when the type is `Play`, it should be a URL to the audio file.

phrase.description: The URL of the audio file to play

response.description: A static response text or message returned to the AI agent's context.

action.description: A list of actions to be performed upon matching.

string.description: The actual input or value from the user or system.

pattern.description: A regular expression pattern to validate or match the string.

output.description: An object that contains a response and a list of actions to be performed upon a expression match.

expressions.description:
A list of expressions to be evaluated upon matching.
If the following properties are set (foreach, expressions, output), they will be processed in the following order:
1. foreach
2. expressions
3. output

error_keys.description: A string or array of strings that represent the keys to be used for error handling. This will match the key(s) in the response from the API call.

url.description: The endpoint for the external service or API.

input_key.description: The key to be used to access the current element in the array.

output_key.description: The key that can be referenced in the output of the `foreach` iteration. The values that are stored from `append` will be stored in this key.

max.description: The max amount of elements that are iterated over in the array. This will start at the beginning of the array.

append.description:
The values to append to the output_key. 
Properties from the object can be referenced and added to the output_key by using the following syntax: 
${this.property_name}.
The `this` keyword is used to reference the current object in the array.

foreach.description:
Iterates over an array of objects and processes a output based on each element in the array. Works similarly to JavaScript's forEach method.
If the following properties are set (foreach, expressions, output), they will be processed in the following order:
1. foreach
2. expressions
3. output

headers.description: Any necessary headers for the API call.

method.description: The HTTP method (GET, POST, etc.) for the API call.

input_args_as_params.description: A boolean to determine if the input arguments should be passed as parameters.

params.description: An object of any necessary parameters for the API call. The key is the parameter name and the value is the parameter value.

require_args.description: A string or array of strings that represent the `arguments` that are required to make the webhook request.

output.description:
An object that contains a response and a list of actions to be performed upon completion of the webhook request.
If the following properties are set (foreach, expressions, output), they will be processed in the following order:
1. foreach
2. expressions
3. output

name.description: The name of the step. The name must be unique within the context. The name is used for referencing the step in the context.

text.description: The prompt or instructions given to the AI at this step.

step_criteria.description:
The conditions that must be met for the conversation to proceed to the next step. 
If a condition is not met, the conversation will not proceed to the next step.
It's **highly** recommended you create a custom criteria for the step to get the intended behavior.

functions.description: An array of strings, where each string is the name of a SWAIG.function that can be executed from this step.

valid_contexts.description: An array of valid contexts that the conversation can transition to from this step.

skip_user_turn.description: A boolean value, if set to `true`, will skip the user's turn to respond in the conversation and proceed to the next step.

end.description: A boolean value, if set to `true`, will end the contexts conversation and transition to a normal interaction.

name.description: The name of the step. The name must be unique within the context. The name is used for referencing the step in the context.

text.description: The prompt or instructions given to the AI at this step.

step_criteria.description:
The conditions that must be met for the conversation to proceed to the next step. 
If a condition is not met, the conversation will not proceed to the next step.
It's **highly** recommended you create a custom criteria for the step to get the intended behavior.

functions.description: An array of strings, where each string is the name of a SWAIG.function that can be executed from this step.

valid_contexts.description: An array of valid contexts that the conversation can transition to from this step.

skip_user_turn.description: A boolean value, if set to `true`, will skip the user's turn to respond in the conversation and proceed to the next step.

valid_steps.description:
An array of valid steps that the conversation can proceed to from this step.
If the array is empty, or the `valid_steps` key is not present, the conversation will proceed to the next step in the context.

nullable.description: Whether the property can be null.

type.description: The type of parameter(s) the AI is passing to the function.

enum.description: An array of strings that are the possible values

StringProperty.description: Base interface for all property types
StringProperty.title: String Function Property

nullable.description: Whether the property can be null.

type.description: The type of parameter(s) the AI is passing to the function.

enum.description: An array of integers that are the possible values

IntegerProperty.description: Base interface for all property types
IntegerProperty.title: Integer Function Property

nullable.description: Whether the property can be null.

type.description: The type of parameter(s) the AI is passing to the function.

enum.description: An array of integers that are the possible values

NumberProperty.description: Base interface for all property types
NumberProperty.title: Number Function Property

nullable.description: Whether the property can be null.

type.description: The type of parameter(s) the AI is passing to the function.

BooleanProperty.description: Base interface for all property types
BooleanProperty.title: Boolean Function Property

nullable.description: Whether the property can be null.

type.description: The type of parameter(s) the AI is passing to the function.

ArrayProperty.description: Base interface for all property types
ArrayProperty.title: Array Function Property

nullable.description: Whether the property can be null.

type.description: The type of parameter(s) the AI is passing to the function.

ObjectProperty.description: Base interface for all property types
ObjectProperty.title: Object Function Property

type.description: The type of parameter(s) the AI is passing to the function.

oneOf.description: An array of schemas where exactly one of the schemas must be valid.

allOf.description: An array of schemas where all of the schemas must be valid.

anyOf.description: An array of schemas where at least one of the schemas must be valid.

const.description: A constant value that can be passed to the function.

SWML.description: A SWML object to be executed.
SWML.title: SWML

system_prompt.description: The instructions to send to the agent. Default is not set.

consolidate.description: Whether to consolidate the context. Default is `false`.

user_prompt.description:
A string serving as simulated user input for the AI Agent.
During a context_switch in the AI's prompt, the user_prompt offers the AI pre-established context or guidance.
Default is not set

context_switch.description: A JSON object containing the context to switch to. Default is not set.
context_switch.title: context_switch

file.description: URL or filepath of the audio file to play.

wait.description: Whether to wait for the audio file to finish playing before continuing. Default is `false`.

playback_bg.description: A JSON object containing the audio file to play.
playback_bg.title: playback_bg

say.description: A message to be spoken by the AI agent.
say.title: say

set_global_data.description: A JSON object containing any global data, as a key-value map. This action sets the data in the `global_data` to be globally referenced.
set_global_data.title: set_global_data

set_meta_data.description: A JSON object containing any metadata, as a key-value map. This action sets the data in the `meta_data` to be referenced locally in the function.
set_meta_data.title: set_meta_data

stop_playback_bg.description: Whether to stop the background audio file.
stop_playback_bg.title: stop_playback_bg

active.description: Whether to activate or deactivate the functions. Default is `true`

toggle_functions.description: Whether to toggle the functions on or off.
toggle_functions.title: toggle_functions

unset_global_data.description: The key of the global data to unset from the `global_meta_data`. You can also reset the `global_meta_data` by passing in a new object.
unset_global_data.title: unset_global_data

unset_meta_data.description: The key of the local data to unset from the `meta_data`. You can also reset the `meta_data` by passing in a new object.
unset_meta_data.title: unset_meta_data

user_input.description: Used to inject text into the users queue as if they input the data themselves.
user_input.title: user_input
